question: What is the normal body temperature in dogs?
ideal_answer: According to the American Kennel Club (AKC), a temperature of 101 to 102.5 degrees Fahrenheit (38.3 to 39.2 degrees Celsius) is typical for dogs

snippets.text: Clinical examination revealed normal rectal temperature (38.3°C)

dian body temperature measured by the experienced investigator with the RDT and the NCIT were 38.3°C (range 35.5°C-41.1°C; 95% CI: 38.2-38.4°C) and 37.7°C (35.9°C-40.1°C; 95% CI: 37.7°C-37.9°C), respectively.

exact_answer: 101 to 102.5 degrees Fahrenheit  or 38.3 to 39.2 degrees Celsius
